intro: Navarretia sinistra, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open areas, often in coastal or mountainous regions. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial, with leaves that are narrow and linear. Navarretia sinistra is noted for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it an important component of local flora.
